You are an expert chef and cooking teacher. You have deep understanding of cooking, baking and teching making food.
Your job is to generate a cooking recipes.
Your Goals are as follows :
1) Create a recipe for the below query :
    How to make spinach pasta
2) You have to describe the recpie in steps with description of each step
3) INPUT you will be given
    You will get detailed 1 or multiple recipes like below example
    The dish is a simple sauted spinach with garlic, seasoned with salt and pepper, and finished with a touch of butter. It's a quick and easy side dish suitable for two to three people.
 1: Finely chop a tablespoon and a half of garlic.
 2: Heat a skillet with a tablespoon to a tablespoon and a half of oil, then add the chopped garlic to the skillet, making sure not to burn it.
 3: Add half a pound of washed spinach on top of the garlic in the skillet.
 4: Stir the spinach, turning it over to prevent the garlic from burning and to distribute the garlic evenly.
 5: Add the rest of the spinach to the skillet, noting that the moisture from the washed spinach will help it cook down.
 6: Season the spinach with a dash of salt and pepper.
 7: Cover the skillet to increase moisture and help the spinach break down, shaking occasionally to ensure even wilting.
 8: Finish the dish by adding a couple of teaspoons of butter, then let it cook uncovered to evaporate some of the moisture. The dish is ready when the spinach is wilted and cooked to preference.

The dish is a simple spaghetti recipe for two, featuring a sauce made with anchovies, garlic, jalapeno pepper, parmesan cheese, and olive oil, finished with parsley.
 1: Cook half a pound of spaghetti in boiling water until it reaches the desired doneness, typically between 11 to 15 minutes.
 2: Extend the pasta in the boiling water to ensure it melts evenly.
 3: Prepare the sauce by adding oil from a container of anchovies into a bowl.
 4: Chop the anchovies and crush three cloves of garlic, then combine them with the oil.
 5: Slice half of a jalapeno pepper and add it to the sauce mixture.
 6: Incorporate a couple of tablespoons of parmesan cheese and two tablespoons of olive oil into the sauce.
 7: Heat the sauce in the microwave for about one to one and a half minutes to cook the garlic.
 8: Drain the cooked pasta, reserving half a cup of the pasta water. Combine the pasta with the heated sauce, adding the reserved pasta water if needed to adjust consistency. Garnish with parsley, additional cheese, and a dash of olive oil before serving.

The dish is a simple yet flavorful meal consisting of sauted chicken thighs with crispy skin, served with a side of steamed garlic spinach.
 1: Prepare the chicken thighs by placing them skin side down and cutting around the bone to expose it, which aids in cooking.
 2: Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper on both sides.
 3: Start cooking the chicken thighs skin side down in a nonstick skillet without any added fat, as the skin will release enough fat for cooking.
 4: Brown the chicken thighs for 2 to 3 minutes on high heat, then cover with a lid and cook for about 20 minutes on low heat without turning them.
 5: While the chicken cooks, prepare the garlic by crushing it to remove the skin.
 6: After the chicken has cooked for 20 minutes and is tender and browned, remove it from the skillet and set aside.
 7: In the same skillet with the chicken drippings, add the crushed garlic and shake the skillet to mix, then add the baby spinach.
 8: Add a couple of tablespoons of water to the skillet to start the steaming process for the spinach, cover it, and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and cook for another minute.

Pasta vasoule (likely a variation of pasta e fagioli) is an Italian specialty consisting of pasta and beans in a rich and savory broth, finished with Parmesan cheese and herbs.
 1: Start by heating a couple of tablespoons of good olive oil in a pot.
 2: Add about 3/4 cup of pancetta (unsmoked bacon) to the pot and saut.
 3: Chop a good cup of onion and add it to the pot with the pancetta.
 4: Crush 3 cloves of garlic to make about a tablespoon of chopped garlic and add it to the pot.
 5: Cook the mixture for 2 to 3 minutes until it starts browning.
 6: Pour in a cup and a half of chicken stock and a cup and a quarter of a mixture of diced tomato and puree of tomato. Season with at least half a teaspoon of salt and half a teaspoon of ground pepper.
 7: Drain a can of cannelloni beans and add them to the pot, along with some of the bean juice if desired.
 8: Bring the mixture to a boil, then add a good cup of penne pasta (about 4 ounces). Cover and continue boiling until the pasta is cooked, about 20 minutes.
 9: Once the pasta is cooked, enrich the dish with a tablespoon or so of butter and a couple of tablespoons of chives or parsley.
 10: Bring the dish back to a boil, check for seasoning, and adjust with more salt and pepper if needed.
 11: Serve the pasta vasoule with Parmesan cheese on top and maybe a little extra green for garnish.
